Production tip.
Any chance you can enable a High-Pass Filter (HPF) on your mic input? This will cut out all the low frequency BOOM, BOOM, every time you touch, knock the mic stand/boom. This BOOM is very evident when listening on headphones.
This is something i notice A LOT with youtubers ;-) So pass it on to the other OLF boys if you can.

With all good mixing desks, you'll have this feature on every mic input channel, usually near the top, just under the gain pot. Usually cutting somewhere from below around 80Hz... As artist will be handling mic stands a lot, and stamping their feet on the stage, etc... Usually enabled for all vocals and most instruments, apart from the the obvious, kick drums, side toms, bass guitar, etc! Vocals just don't produce anything that low! It massively cuts out booming, muddying the sound coming out of the PA... And headphones.
